title: When nonvested property interest or power of appointment created
context: [ยง525-2] When nonvested property interest or power of appointment created. (a) Except as provided in subsections (b) and &copy; and in section 525-5(a), the time of creation of a nonvested property interest or a power of appointment is determined under general principles of property law. (b) For the purposes of this chapter, if there is a person who alone can exercise a power created by a governing instrument to become the unqualified beneficial owner of a nonvested property interest or a property interest subject to a power of appointment described in section 525-1(b) or &copy;, the nonvested property interest or power of appointment is created when the power to become the unqualified beneficial owner terminates. For the purposes of this chapter, a joint power with respect to community property under chapter 510 held by individuals married to each other is a power exercisable by one person alone. &copy; For the purposes of this chapter, a nonvested property interest or a power of appointment arising from a transfer of property to a previously funded trust or other existing property arrangement is created when the nonvested property interest or power of appointment in the original contribution was created. [L 1992, c 262, pt of ยง2] Revision Note In subsection (a), section &ldquo;525-5(a)&rdquo; substituted for &ldquo;525-4(a)&rdquo;.
